So just to set the stage, so hiver is a AI powered help desk solution built on and we're essentially a Chrome extension that's built on top of Gmail.

What this does is it augments shared inboxes or like any sort of shared channel allowing for full visibility into who's owning it, making it really easy to catch up on conversations that might be happening, you know, kind of in a siloed view, pushing them to a shared inbox.
So when you go in there to chat with the conversation or chat with the customer, you should have everything in one place.
So we would create an inbox per customer.
Basically, is that what the idea would be?
Or like an alias?
Yeah.
So you could either have an alias per customer or we have a way of routing named accounts based on, you know, the account owner.
Okay?
So you could do it.
Either way depends how special you want the customer to feel.
Nice.
Yeah.
So this should look pretty familiar.
The, you know, top part, traditional Gmail.
Everything in yellow is hiver related.
Okay.
So if you have like a support info at custom domain for the customer, everything will funnel into one inbox.
And then we have a litany of ways of assignment, but it could be skill based, ownership based capacity based.

And when the conversation comes in before we even click into it, we have an SLA, amended… sentiment, AI sentiment and then various ways of tagging which could be keyword based or AI based tagging to like more delineate where this is going.

Now, when I enter the conversation here, you know, Jake from Phoenix digital is asking for, you know, payment extension… on the right hand rail is where we have our ownership so it could be assigned to a specific person or if you wanted to like loop in accounting, we could move this to a different shared inbox as needed… like very prevalent if it's not actually support related.
And then we're trying to give you more as much information on the contact as possible.
So, in Jake's case, we have other emails that Jake has sent in that we can link out to… domain level emails that Jake's Phoenix digital is writing about.
And then we have a connected app experience where we have over 100 applications that including Salesforce that we're able to populate data in.
So kind of the whole concept is, how do we give you more information about this customer in the Gmail inbox?
And then finally, when I go to reply, let… me just get rid of my old note.
You know, we offer like a full template library kind of like what you'd expect.

And one thing that's interesting is let's say you're like a customer success manager and you're like, hey, I actually want to, you know, work with my engineering team because maybe there's like some slight nuance that we want to just like confirm.
I can draft the email here, share it as a draft and now reassign it to that engineer or at mention of a group bye.
So that's kind of just my quick overview of how this works conceptually.
